column1: There is no playbook for COVID campaigning. Whether socially distant in your town squares live streamed or on endless Zooms it is my job to make my affirmative case for re-election to the people of this district. Seven more days — let’s leave it all on the field! #MI08 https://t.co/iA34M59o5y

Any day we wear hardhats is a good day. So we had a good day at Operating Engineers Local 324 in Howell today. They have adapted their spaces to stay safe from COVID-19. Also had an important chat about safety for highway workers: Give 'em a brake and don't drive distracted! https://t.co/M4BrYr7dio

Few know Michigan politics better than @michpoligal - formerly of @freep and now writing for @nytimes - who lays out the challenges of this race without MSU students on campus. We have an opponent but we're also running against COVID-19. https://t.co/YdjGamRO7l
We had a chance to chat about how business has been during COVID as well as try their amazing bagels. And keeping in the tradition Mike was sporting a Spartan shirt!
Michigan was hard hit by COVID. Voting against relief puts politics above people and she will not stand for that. #MI08debate https://t.co/XUljFjAIMf

Elissa worked with the bipartisan Problem Solvers Caucus to break through months of stalled COVID-19 talks and get both parties’ leadership back to the negotiating table because she puts residents of Michigan’s 8th before party politics. #MI08debate https://t.co/gjrE5uh3Ld

In the COVID era reaching voters where they are takes some creativity. Here in Michigan we’re still pumping gas. So we got inventive and are aiming for that captive audience when they’re at the pump. That’s right we’re officially up on gas pump video screens! https://t.co/Hrl2ekcvV2

Elissa worked with the bipartisan Problem Solvers Caucus to present a new COVID relief bill. Her efforts pushed leadership to reverse course & put that bill on the House next week. This is the bipartisan work Elissa is known for. https://t.co/GWIZKpaFnk

The bipartisan Problem Solvers Caucus COVID-19 relief plan that Elissa helped introduce pushed House leadership back to the negotiating table. That’s what bipartisan leadership is all about. #MI08debate https://t.co/Xy8hsf0B4d

A member of the Problem Solvers Caucus Elissa worked with Democrats and Republicans to write a bipartisan compromise COVID aid package and she called on her leadership to put getting people the relief they need over partisan politics. #MI08 #MI08debate

In Washington this week I stood up with Democrats and Republicans to push for a bipartisan COVID relief package. Now I’m back in the district and tomorrow I’ll be in Lake Orion to meet with constituents about it. RSVP to join us! https://t.co/4OL3m9ldFS https://t.co/Q1QGaI5GWL

I’m grateful for the support of the Lansing Regional Chamber and for our work together helping businesses cope with COVID-19. I’m proud to partner with the Chamber to help our businesses survive and thrive. https://t.co/H5gjplzyag

Thank you @DrBiden for joining the conversation with educators and parents about one of the most critical issues facing Michigan families: educating our kids in the COVID-19 era. https://t.co/un0oiOA9Ch
Labor Day takes on a special resonance this year because of COVID. Workers’ rights have never been more relevant. I’ll continue to fight for hard-fought union gains. https://t.co/GmCpX8Lp0G
The first TV ads of our campaign focus on the positive case I’m making and the fight to protect health care workers fighting COVID-19. My opponent…well he’s taking another path.
The shop’s tools include a sanitization spray gun purchased from a paint company in Howell! This has got to be the most fun you can have stopping the spread of COVID-19. https://t.co/k9MfcKqC4o

One of the coolest things we saw on Saturday while visiting businesses in Brighton was at @Londonbeautykat which is weathering COVID as a relatively new business selling American-made beauty supplies. https://t.co/lzRcHMcKTo

Our day in Brighton gave us a chance to reach voters at our Mill Pond event and see how the downtown is adjusting to the challenges of COVID-19. We started at the Brighton Farmers Market. Dave picked up some silly putty (he thinks it’s great fun) and some beautiful produce. https://t.co/DN7hJBXwKh

Thank you to the Michigan Manufacturing Technology Center and to 8th District manufacturers for helping me highlight what we have long known in Michigan and that COVID-19 taught the rest of the nation: a strong manufacturing sector is a national security asset. https://t.co/LyTAhQCEvL

Finally to Studio Shop. Will runs a photo studio and Michigan-themed gift shop in downtown Williamston. COVID has hit his business hard but he's adding to the mural to the side of his shop for outdoor socially-distant portrait sessions. Picked up something for our DC office! https://t.co/gBzxCvTbUG

Today’s socially distanced gathering in Clarkston showed how we can reach voters in person and online even amid COVID-19. Thanks to everyone for a great discussion about fighting COVID affordable health care protecting our waters and bringing civility and decency to politics. https://t.co/LIZZsdlbS5

Wearing a mask in public keeps our community safe— and is the least we can do to respect the work front-line health care workers are performing in battling COVID-19. And now you can show your support for our campaign with our official masks! https://t.co/5fHRaVm1Tm https://t.co/n4xNBroswb

Campaigning during COVID: Team Slotkin organizers and fellows have been hard at work training volunteers phone banking and spreading the word about how to safely vote by mail this fall. Sign up to meet our amazing team right from your own home! https://t.co/CdqD41WDKy https://t.co/JkvGgUbFVI

While it wasn't the day we had originally envisioned our campaign launch provided us a chance to highlight creativity and ingenuity. Sign up to take part in one of the many ways we have reimagined safely campaigning during COVID. https://t.co/umHr2j8UFd

Wondering what it looks like to campaign during COVID? It looks like this! While we couldn’t bring everyone together in person via our livestream we were still able to reach hundreds from the safety of their own homes. A new kind of campaign for a new era! https://t.co/PxVw8mu41d

It is a day of celebration that takes on special meaning this year with the coronavirus and the widespread demonstrations on racial justice. Today we celebrate the beginning of a struggle not finished.

Thanks to Katie & Mike for sharing their experience with @MertsMeats in the COVID era. Workers there are going above & beyond to continue feeding our community while following safety guidelines. Thank you to them and to all front-line workers keeping food on our tables! https://t.co/qj4fqFKvIR
Today because of COVID-19 many of us who would otherwise be at Memorial Day events and services are home doing our best to halt the virus.

People in my district are looking to see how all the elected leaders who represent them handle COVID-19 and will probably factor that into their decision when it comes to voting. I discussed politics in a pandemic with Fox News Radio’s Rundown. https://t.co/i17W2jikly

I took this pic of my mail so I can remember what life is like under COVID. Today I received: 1) a religious pamphlet about COVID-19; 2) two ads enticing me to buy yard signs for my campaign; https://t.co/Erx7D0fNQt

Yesterday Michigan had its first test of holding an election during COVID-19 — and the results are informative. More than 200 communities held local elections and turnout was a record 24 percent more than double participation in the average May election.

When it comes to helping Michigan communities weather #COVID19 we can’t bog down in partisan debates. Our local governments need help to keep fighting this virus and that’s not a Red vs. Blue issue. https://t.co/Ed8Mi4qqAG

Want to help out the campaign from your own kitchen table? As part of adapting our campaign to meet the reality of COVID-19 we are officially launching the 2020 postcard program! In 2018 we sent over 10000 postcards to potential voters a key component in our victory.
Even as COVID-19 demands our attention other key issues endure. I am proud to have the endorsement of @CleanWaterMI and to work with them to protect Michigan waters from PFAS and other contaminants.

Over the past month 70+ of our volunteers have made nearly 6500 check-in calls - not to ask for votes but to connect people with COVID-19 resources collect feedback and provide basic human connection to those who may not get quite enough. The stories speak for themselves. https://t.co/jlf1XBLikH
I gave an update of my work responding to COVID-19 and discussed ways for the senior community to protect themselves in this unprecedented time.

Our health care workers are fighting #COVID19 every day. And I’m proud to join leaders of both parties across Michigan who are fighting for them. We won’t stop because they won’t stop fighting this virus. https://t.co/0U18WKwm9u

Our health care professionals are in a front-line battle against #COVID19. We can’t send them to the front lines without their armor. Thank you to @CrookedMedia for highlighting how the Defense Production Act can get them the protection and supplies they need. https://t.co/vGwmXwOAXF

There will be a time to campaign. Today is about getting through the crisis. I am so proud of our dedicated volunteers and grateful to them for stepping up to help fight #COVID19. We will hold more training sessions next week. https://t.co/O18kjpijAi

In our first two sessions we trained about 130 volunteers on how to check in on seniors in our district and if needed send them to the right people who can help them get any services they need. We also highlighted other ways they can volunteer in the fight against #COVID19.

We are transforming our army of volunteers to focus on wellness checks on our neighbors: Our volunteers will call to check in on folks at a time of crisis and to direct them to state and federal resources available to help weather the #COVID19 storm.

This week we held the first two training sessions for our dedicated volunteers on how to support 8th District residents amid the #COVID19 crisis. These volunteers have been instrumental in asking voters to support me -- and they’re eager to support the people of #MI08.
I'll join @allinwithchris just after 8 p.m. to discuss how we can help #MI08 families and businesses weather the coronavirus.
